jei.info.analog_redstone_torch:
To select the power output, scroll (+ scroll key if set).

Can be locked (preventing scroll) by using a redstone torch on it (analog or vanilla).
jei.info.analog_lever:
To select the power output, scroll (+ scroll key if set).

Can be locked (preventing scroll) by using a redstone torch on it (analog or vanilla).
jei.info.analog_button:
To select the power output, scroll (+ scroll key if set).

Can be locked (preventing scroll) by using a redstone torch on it (analog or vanilla).
jei.info.analog_redstone_block:
To select the power output, scroll (+ scroll key if set).

Can be locked (preventing scroll) by using a redstone torch on it (analog or vanilla).
jei.info.analog_jukebox: This Jukebox has an inventory of 15 disk and will play the corresponding disk when receiving a redstone signal.
jei.info.analog_note_block:
This note block plays sounds with pitch depending on signal strength.

You can change the base pitch to low or high by clicking on it.
jei.info.analog_redstone_lamp: The light level of this lamp is equal to the signal strength received.
jei.info.adder: Exact inverse of the comparator: In 'Compare' mode tests if the back signal is higher or equal to the highest side signal, and in 'Addition' mode, will add the back signal to the highest side signal (up to 15).
jei.info.analog_and: Do the binary operation And (&) on each of the 4 bits of the back signal and the highest side signal.
jei.info.analog_nand: Do the binary operation Nand (!&) on each of the 4 bits of the back signal and the highest side signal.
jei.info.analog_or: Do the binary operation Or (|) on each of the 4 bits of the back signal and the highest side signal.
jei.info.analog_nor: Do the binary operation Nor (!|) on each of the 4 bits of the back signal and the highest side signal.
jei.info.analog_xor: Do the binary operation Xor (^) on each of the 4 bits of the back signal and the highest side signal.
jei.info.analog_xnor: Do the binary operation Xnor (!^) on each of the 4 bits of the back signal and the highest side signal.
jei.info.analog_cell:
Memory cell that can store a analog signal

Two modes:
'Set': When receiving a signal on the side, store the back signal.

'Reset': When the cell receive a side signal, set the memory to 0, otherwise store the back signal whenever it changes for a non 0 strength.
jei.info.better_comparator: Basically a vanilla comparator, but works with 1 tick pulse and the sides can read signals from more sources.
jei.info.checker: Test if the back signal is exactly equal to the highest side signal in 'Equal' mode, or if they are different in 'Different' mode.
jei.info.delayer:
Delays the entering signal by 1,2,3 or 4 ticks, without changing the strength or the length (duration) of the signal.

Has a 5th mode that will delay the signal using the highest side signal (+1).
jei.info.demuxer:
Test if the bit 1,2,4 or 8 of the back signal is on.

Has a 5th mode where the tested bit is selected by the highest side signal (strength of 1->bit 1, 2->bit 2, 3->bit 4, 4->bit 8)
jei.info.edge_detector: Emit a 1 tick pulse when the back signal gets stronger (in 'Rising Edge' mode) or diminishes (in 'Falling Edge' mode).
jei.info.shifter:
Shifts the bits of the back signal up (in 'Shift Up' mode) or down (in 'Shift Down' mode) by the highest side signal strength.
Example: in Up mode, with a side signal of 1, the signal of 6 would become 12.
jei.info.signal_generator:
Generate signals sequentially.

While powered (from the back), advance the sequence.





In 'Saw', 'Inverted Saw', 'Triangle' and 'Random' mode, the output signal will be between 0 and 15 if there is no signal on the sides or the signal will be between the lowest and highest side signal.


In 'Square' mode, the time between oscillations is equal to highest side signal + 1 ticks.

In 'Sinus' mode, the number of degrees per tick is equal to 1 + highest side signal.
jei.info.enriched_redstone: This redstone was mixed with conductive metals and is now more efficient to transport signal over long range, only loosing power every 4 blocks instead of each.
jei.info.perfected_redstone:
Thanks to the improved binding (through sheer heat) of the redstone and metals, you managed to get rid of the power loss entirely!




(Well... almost: for some unknown reason you can't go farther than 32 block without suddenly loosing all signal).
